question: [File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Integration: main.rs] [Panic on invalid selection] When the pre_partitioner_config() method panics on unknown partitioner types, can attackers trigger this panic during live validator operations causing DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Integration: main.rs] [Config deserialization] If config files specify 'uniform' as the partitioner, can malicious config files inject additional fields into UniformPartitionerConfig causing parsing errors or execution failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Integration: UniformPartitioner] [Partitioner consistency] Does build() always create UniformPartitioner instances with identical behavior, or can subtle differences in construction lead to non-deterministic transaction ordering across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Integration: UniformPartitioner] [Shard allocation attack] Can attackers exploit the uniform partitioning strategy by crafting transaction orderings that, when evenly divided, cause specific shards to process malicious transaction sequences? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Integration: UniformPartitioner] [Division edge cases] When UniformPartitioner divides transactions evenly, can edge cases with transaction count % shard count cause inconsistent partition sizes leading to execution timeouts on overloaded shards? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Integration: UniformPartitioner] [Empty block handling] If build() creates a UniformPartitioner that receives an empty block (0 transactions), can this trigger division-by-zero or other edge case bugs in the partition logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Concurrency: build()] [Concurrent build calls] If multiple threads call build() on the same UniformPartitionerConfig instance simultaneously, can race conditions create corrupted partitioner instances with inconsistent internal state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Concurrency: Clone+Build] [Clone-build race] Can a race condition occur between cloning UniformPartitionerConfig and calling build() on the clone, leading to use-after-free or double-free vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Concurrency: Arc wrapping] [Arc<Config> safety] When UniformPartitionerConfig is wrapped in Arc for shared ownership across executor threads, can reference counting bugs lead to premature deallocation during active partitioning? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Concurrency: Mutex contention] [Lock-free access] Does the zero-sized UniformPartitionerConfig require any synchronization primitives, or can excessive lock contention occur if incorrectly wrapped in Mutex during concurrent access? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Determinism: build()] [Non-deterministic construction] Can build() produce UniformPartitioner instances with non-deterministic behavior based on system state, ASLR, or timing, causing validators to partition blocks differently? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Determinism: Trait dispatch] [Virtual dispatch determinism] Does the virtual dispatch through Box<dyn PrePartitioner> guarantee deterministic behavior, or can vtable pointer variations cause different execution paths across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Determinism: Memory layout] [ASLR impact] Can Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) affect the behavior of code relying on UniformPartitionerConfig memory addresses, causing non-deterministic partitioning decisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Determinism: Compiler optimization] [Optimization variation] Can different compiler optimization levels or Rust compiler versions produce UniformPartitionerConfig code with different runtime behavior, breaking consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [State: Immutability] [Config mutation] Can external code mutate UniformPartitionerConfig after it's used to build a partitioner, retroactively affecting partitioner behavior and violating immutability invariants? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [State: Builder consistency] [Multiple builds] If build() is called multiple times on the same UniformPartitionerConfig, do all calls produce functionally identical partitioners, or can state leak between invocations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [State: Config versioning] [Version compatibility] If UniformPartitionerConfig format changes across Aptos versions, can old configs cause execution failures or security vulnerabilities when loaded by new validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [DoS: Rapid builds] [Build flooding] Can an attacker repeatedly build new UniformPartitioner instances through rapid build() calls, exhausting memory or CPU resources and degrading validator performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [DoS: Box allocation] [Heap exhaustion] Can Box::new() allocations in build() be exploited to exhaust heap memory through sustained high-frequency partitioner creation during block processing spikes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [DoS: Partitioner leaks] [Memory leak exploitation] If built UniformPartitioner instances are not properly dropped, can an attacker trigger memory leaks through crafted block sequences that bypass cleanup logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Error: Build failure] [Panic propagation] If Box::new(UniformPartitioner {}) panics due to allocation failure, can this panic propagate and crash the validator during critical consensus operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Error: OOM handling] [Out-of-memory] When build() encounters out-of-memory conditions during Box allocation, can recovery logic safely handle this without corrupting PartitionerV2 state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Error: Trait conversion] [Downcast vulnerability] Can malicious code attempt unsafe downcasting from Box<dyn PrePartitioner> back to UniformPartitioner, potentially violating type safety and memory safety? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Cross-module: mod.rs dependency] [Module injection] Can attackers manipulate the module system to substitute a malicious uniform_partitioner/mod.rs, causing UniformPartitionerConfig to build compromised partitioners? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/pre_partition/uniform_partitioner/config.rs] [Cross-module: Trait definition] [Trait poisoning] Can malicious code redefine the PrePartitionerConfig trait in scope before UniformPartitionerConfig is used, causing incorrect trait method resolution? (High)
